trans-unit.source: Provides a managed way of dynamically viewing, creating or invoking types supported by an XML Web service.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionReflector"></xref> class.
Creates a <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription"></xref> including the specified <xref:System.Type> for the XML Web service at the specified URL.
This method examines the metadata for the XML Web service at the specified URL.

If the specified <xref:System.Type> is not supported, it modifies the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) file corresponding to the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> describing the XML Web service, in order to include that type.
For more information about Web Services Description Language (WSDL), see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
The <xref:System.Type> of the class or interface to reflect.
The address (URL) of the XML Web service.
Gets a reference to the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemas"></xref> associated with the XML Web service.
This property is initialized with a <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A> of zero.
Any members must be explicitly added using the collection's <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSchemas.Add%2A> method.
For more information about Web Services Description Language (WSDL), see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
Gets a reference to the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionCollection"></xref> associated with the XML Web service.
This property is initialized with a <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A> of zero.
Any members must be explicitly added using the collection's <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionCollection.Add%2A> method.
For more information about Web Services Description Language (WSDL), see the specification at http://www.w3.org/TR/wsdl/.
A reference to the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionCollection"></xref> associated with the XML Web service.
